AFG.overview: Landlocked country in South Asia; rugged mountains and deserts. Capital Kabul.
AFG.knownFor: Ancient Silk Road, carpets, lapis lazuli, and decades of conflict and resilience.
AFG.quickHistory: Historical crossroads of empires. Independence 1919. Soviet invasion (1979–1989), Taliban rule, and NATO presence shaped modern history.

ALB.overview: Small Balkan country on the Adriatic and Ionian seas. Capital Tirana.
ALB.knownFor: Stunning coastlines, Ottoman heritage, bunkers, and emerging tourism.
ALB.quickHistory: Illyrian and Roman past. Ottoman rule for centuries. Independent 1912. Communist isolation under Hoxha; opened up after 1991.

DZA.overview: Largest country in Africa by area; Mediterranean coast and vast Sahara. Capital Algiers.
DZA.knownFor: Roman ruins (Timgad, Djemila), Sahara desert, and oil and gas.
DZA.quickHistory: Numidian, Roman, and Arab heritage. French colony 1830–1962. Independence after a long war; single-party then multi-party state.

AGO.overview: Southwest African country on the Atlantic. Capital Luanda.
AGO.knownFor: Oil, diamonds, wildlife (including giant sable), and Portuguese-speaking culture.
AGO.quickHistory: Portuguese colony for centuries. Independence 1975; long civil war until 2002. Now a major oil producer.

ATA.overview: Frozen continent around the South Pole; no permanent population.
ATA.knownFor: Scientific research, penguins, ice sheets, and extreme climate.
ATA.quickHistory: Formally discovered in the 19th century. Antarctic Treaty (1959) reserves it for peace and science; territorial claims suspended.

ARG.overview: Large South American country; Pampas, Patagonia, and Andes. Capital Buenos Aires.
ARG.knownFor: Tango, beef, wine, football (Maradona, Messi), and dramatic landscapes.
ARG.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1816. Waves of European immigration. Periods of military rule and economic crises; democracy since 1983.

ARM.overview: Landlocked in the South Caucasus. Capital Yerevan.
ARM.knownFor: Ancient Christian heritage, Mount Ararat views, brandy, and tech sector.
ARM.quickHistory: One of the oldest Christian nations. Soviet from 1920; independent 1991. Conflict with Azerbaijan over Nagorno-Karabakh.

AUS.overview: Island continent in the Pacific. Capital Canberra; Sydney and Melbourne are major cities.
AUS.knownFor: Unique wildlife, beaches, Outback, wine, and multicultural cities.
AUS.quickHistory: British colonization from 1788. Federation 1901. Strong ties to UK and US; diverse immigration and Indigenous heritage.

AUT.overview: Landlocked in Central Europe; Alps and Danube. Capital Vienna.
AUT.knownFor: Classical music (Mozart, Strauss), Alps, coffeehouses, and skiing.
AUT.quickHistory: Heart of the Habsburg Empire. Annexed by Nazi Germany; neutral after 1955. EU member; high standard of living.

AZE.overview: Caucasus country on the Caspian Sea. Capital Baku.
AZE.knownFor: Oil and gas, mud volcanoes, carpet weaving, and modern architecture.
AZE.quickHistory: Ancient Turkic and Persian influence. Soviet from 1920; independent 1991. Conflict with Armenia over Nagorno-Karabakh.

BGD.overview: Dense, low-lying South Asian country; Ganges delta. Capital Dhaka.
BGD.knownFor: Textiles and garment industry, rivers, tea, and resilience to floods.
BGD.quickHistory: Part of British India; East Pakistan 1947; independent Bangladesh 1971 after war. High population density; growing economy.

BLR.overview: Landlocked in Eastern Europe. Capital Minsk.
BLR.knownFor: Forests, Soviet-era architecture, and IT sector.
BLR.quickHistory: Part of USSR; independent 1991. Long-standing authoritarian rule and close ties to Russia; contested elections and protests.

BEL.overview: Small Western European country; Brussels is EU and NATO HQ. Capital Brussels.
BEL.knownFor: Chocolate, beer, waffles, comics (Tintin), and EU institutions.
BEL.quickHistory: Independent 1830. Colonial power in Africa. Host to EU and NATO; linguistically divided (Dutch, French, German).

BLZ.overview: Central American country on the Caribbean. Capital Belmopan.
BLZ.knownFor: Barrier reef, Maya ruins, English-speaking, and ecotourism.
BLZ.quickHistory: British Honduras until 1973; independent Belize 1981. Only Central American country with English as official language.

BEN.overview: West African country between Togo and Nigeria. Capital Porto-Novo.
BEN.knownFor: Birthplace of vodun (voodoo), Ouidah history, and cotton.
BEN.quickHistory: Dahomey kingdom; French colony. Independent 1960 as Dahomey, renamed Benin 1975. Multiparty democracy since 1990.

BTN.overview: Himalayan kingdom between India and China. Capital Thimphu.
BTN.knownFor: Gross National Happiness, monasteries, trekking, and carbon-negative status.
BTN.quickHistory: Buddhist monarchy; never colonized. Opened to tourism cautiously; constitutional monarchy since 2008.

BOL.overview: Landlocked in central South America; Altiplano and Amazon. Capital Sucre; La Paz is seat of government.
BOL.knownFor: Salar de Uyuni, indigenous culture, and coca.
BOL.quickHistory: Named after Bolívar. Spanish colony; independence 1825. Tin and silver; political instability and social movements.

BIH.overview: Balkan country; Sarajevo was host to the 1984 Winter Olympics. Capital Sarajevo.
BIH.knownFor: Ottoman and Austro-Hungarian heritage, mountains, and postwar recovery.
BIH.quickHistory: Part of Yugoslavia; independence 1992; brutal war until 1995. Complex state with two entities and three constituent peoples.

BWA.overview: Southern African country; stable democracy. Capital Gaborone.
BWA.quickHistory: British protectorate Bechuanaland; independent Botswana 1966. Diamonds drove growth; one of Africa's most stable democracies.

BRA.overview: Largest country in South America; Amazon and long coast. Capital Brasília.
BRA.knownFor: Carnival, football, samba, Amazon rainforest, and coffee.
BRA.quickHistory: Portuguese colony; independence 1822. Empire then republic. Periods of dictatorship; democracy since 1985. Major emerging economy.

BRN.overview: Small sultanate on Borneo. Capital Bandar Seri Begawan.
BRN.knownFor: Oil wealth, rainforest, and Islamic monarchy.
BRN.quickHistory: British protectorate; full independence 1984. Sultan rules with substantial oil revenues; high standard of living.

BGR.overview: Balkan country on the Black Sea. Capital Sofia.
BGR.knownFor: Yogurt, roses, Cyrillic script origin, and Thracian heritage.
BGR.quickHistory: Slavic and Bulgar state; Ottoman rule for centuries. Independent 1878; communist era; EU member 2007.

BFA.overview: Landlocked West African country. Capital Ouagadougou.
BFA.knownFor: Film festival (FESPACO), cotton, and Sahel culture.
BFA.quickHistory: French Upper Volta; independent 1960; renamed Burkina Faso 1984. Repeated coups and jihadist violence in recent years.

BDI.overview: Small landlocked country in East Africa. Capital Gitega.
BDI.knownFor: Coffee, tea, and tragic ethnic conflict.
BDI.quickHistory: Belgian-administered; independent 1962. Hutu–Tutsi violence, including genocide in 1993; fragile stability.

KHM.overview: Southeast Asian kingdom; home to Angkor. Capital Phnom Penh.
KHM.knownFor: Angkor Wat, Khmer Rouge history, and Mekong.
KHM.quickHistory: Khmer Empire; French protectorate. Independence 1953. Khmer Rouge genocide (1975–1979); recovery and tourism.

CMR.overview: Central African country; coast on the Gulf of Guinea. Capital Yaoundé.
CMR.knownFor: Football, coffee, cocoa, and linguistic diversity (French and English).
CMR.quickHistory: German then French/British rule; independent 1960–61. Anglophone–Francophone tensions and long-serving president.

CAN.overview: Large North American country; second-largest by area. Capital Ottawa.
CAN.knownFor: Maple syrup, ice hockey, vast wilderness, multiculturalism, and Niagara Falls.
CAN.quickHistory: French and British colonization; confederation 1867. Peaceful evolution to full independence; bilingual and diverse.

CAF.overview: Landlocked in central Africa. Capital Bangui.
CAF.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1960. Coups and rebellions; UN and French interventions; one of the world's poorest.

TCD.overview: Landlocked in central Africa; includes part of Lake Chad. Capital N'Djamena.
TCD.knownFor: Lake Chad, oil, and Sahelian culture.
TCD.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1960. Long civil conflict; Boko Haram and regional instability; oil exports.

CHL.overview: Long, narrow country along the Pacific and Andes. Capital Santiago.
CHL.knownFor: Copper, wine, Patagonia, and Pablo Neruda.
CHL.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1818. Pinochet dictatorship (1973–1990); return to democracy; strong economy.

CHN.overview: Most populous country; East Asian powerhouse. Capital Beijing.
CHN.knownFor: Great Wall, dynastic history, tea, cuisine, and manufacturing.
CHN.quickHistory: Ancient civilization; republic 1912; communist from 1949. Reform and opening from late 1970s; global economic and political weight.

COL.overview: Northwest South America; Pacific and Caribbean coasts. Capital Bogotá.
COL.knownFor: Coffee, emeralds, Gabriel García Márquez, and biodiversity.
COL.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1819. Long guerrilla conflict; peace deal with FARC (2016); growing tourism and tech.

CRI.overview: Central American country; no standing army. Capital San José.
CRI.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1821. Abolished army 1949; stable democracy and green reputation.

HRV.overview: Balkan country on the Adriatic. Capital Zagreb.
HRV.knownFor: Dalmatian coast, Dubrovnik, Plitvice Lakes, and football.
HRV.quickHistory: Part of Yugoslavia; independent 1991 after war. EU member; tourism and EU funds drive growth.

CUB.knownFor: Cigars, vintage cars, salsa, revolution, and classic architecture.
CUB.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1902. Castro revolution 1959; decades of US embargo; recent economic reforms.

CYP.overview: Island in the eastern Mediterranean. Capital Nicosia.
CYP.knownFor: Divided capital, beaches, ancient sites, and EU membership.
CYP.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1960. Greek–Turkish conflict; island split 1974; EU member (south) since 2004.

CZE.overview: Central European country; no coastline. Capital Prague.
CZE.knownFor: Pilsner beer, castles, Kafka, and Velvet Revolution.
CZE.quickHistory: Part of Czechoslovakia; peaceful split 1993. EU and NATO member; strong industry and tourism.

COD.overview: Large central African country; Congo River. Capital Kinshasa.
COD.knownFor: Congo River, minerals, gorillas, and complex conflicts.
COD.quickHistory: Belgian Congo; independent 1960. Mobutu rule; two Congo wars; eastern instability and mineral exploitation.

DNK.overview: Nordic country; Jutland and islands. Capital Copenhagen.
DNK.knownFor: Hygge, design, Vikings, Lego, and wind energy.
DNK.quickHistory: Viking age; unified kingdom. Neutral in WWII; EU member (with opt-outs). High equality and quality of life.

DJI.overview: Small Horn of Africa country on the Red Sea. Capital Djibouti.
DJI.knownFor: Strategic port, French and US bases, and salt lake.
DJI.quickHistory: French territory; independent 1977. Key logistics hub; authoritarian rule; limited resources.

DOM.overview: Caribbean country sharing Hispaniola with Haiti. Capital Santo Domingo.
DOM.knownFor: First European settlement in Americas, baseball, merengue, and beaches.
DOM.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1844. Long Trujillo dictatorship; democracy and tourism; contrasts with Haiti.

TLS.overview: Southeast Asian half-island nation. Capital Dili.
TLS.knownFor: Coffee, resistance history, and young independence.
TLS.quickHistory: Portuguese Timor; occupied by Indonesia 1975–1999. Independent 2002; oil and nation-building.

ECU.overview: Pacific and Amazon country on the equator. Capital Quito.
ECU.quickHistory: Part of Gran Colombia; independent 1830. Oil exporter; dollarized economy; biodiversity and tourism.

EGY.overview: North African country; Nile and Suez. Capital Cairo.
EGY.knownFor: Pyramids, ancient civilization, Nile, and Arab Spring.
EGY.quickHistory: Pharaonic then Greco-Roman and Arab. British influence; republic 1952. Peace with Israel; recent authoritarian turn.

SLV.overview: Smallest Central American country; Pacific coast. Capital San Salvador.
SLV.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1821. Civil war 1980s; peace 1992; gangs and migration to US.

GNQ.overview: Small country on the Gulf of Guinea. Capital Malabo.
GNQ.knownFor: Oil, Spanish-speaking Africa, and authoritarian rule.
GNQ.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independent 1968. Oil wealth; dictatorship and human-rights concerns.

ERI.overview: Horn of Africa country on the Red Sea. Capital Asmara.
ERI.knownFor: Art Deco Asmara, long national service, and isolation.
ERI.quickHistory: Italian then British; federation with Ethiopia; independent 1993. Authoritarian; mass emigration.

EST.overview: Baltic country on the Gulf of Finland. Capital Tallinn.
EST.knownFor: E-government, medieval Old Town, and tech sector.
EST.quickHistory: Soviet 1940–1991; independent again. EU and NATO; digital society and strong growth.

ETH.overview: Landlocked Horn of Africa country. Capital Addis Ababa.
ETH.knownFor: Coffee origin, Lucy, Orthodox Christianity, and running.
ETH.quickHistory: Ancient kingdom; never fully colonized. Emperor Haile Selassie; Marxist regime; federal republic; recent conflict in Tigray.

FLK.overview: South Atlantic British territory. Capital Stanley.
FLK.quickHistory: British since 1833; Argentina claims sovereignty; brief war 1982.

FJI.overview: Pacific island nation; many islands. Capital Suva.
FJI.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1970. Coups and ethnic tension; democracy restored; tourism and sugar.

FIN.overview: Nordic country between Sweden and Russia. Capital Helsinki.
FIN.knownFor: Sauna, Nokia, education, design, and lakes.
FIN.quickHistory: Swedish then Russian rule; independent 1917. Winter War with USSR; EU member; high tech and equality.

FRA.overview: Western European country; Mediterranean to Channel. Capital Paris.
FRA.knownFor: Wine, cheese, fashion, art, Eiffel Tower, and revolution.
FRA.quickHistory: Gaul, kingdom, revolution 1789. Napoleonic era; republics and empires. EU founder; global culture and influence.

ATF.overview: French Southern and Antarctic Territories; scattered islands.
ATF.knownFor: Research bases, wildlife, and no permanent civilian population.
ATF.quickHistory: French overseas territory; reserved for science and environment.

GAB.overview: Central African country on the Atlantic. Capital Libreville.
GAB.knownFor: Oil, rainforest, and low population density.
GAB.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1960. Oil-dependent; long Bongo family rule; stable by regional standards.

GMB.overview: Smallest mainland African country; surrounded by Senegal. Capital Banjul.
GMB.knownFor: River Gambia, birds, and peanut exports.
GMB.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1965. Tourism and agriculture; political transition in 2016.

GEO.overview: Caucasus country on the Black Sea. Capital Tbilisi.
GEO.knownFor: Wine origin, mountains, and Soviet then pro-Western path.
GEO.quickHistory: Ancient kingdoms; Russian then Soviet. Independent 1991; Rose Revolution 2003; conflict with Russia over breakaway regions.

DEU.knownFor: Engineering, beer, cars, history, and EU leadership.
DEU.quickHistory: Holy Roman Empire; unification 1871. Two world wars; division and reunification 1990. EU's largest economy.

GHA.overview: West African country on the Gulf of Guinea. Capital Accra.
GHA.knownFor: Gold, cocoa, pan-Africanism, and stable democracy.
GHA.quickHistory: Gold Coast; independent 1957, first in sub-Saharan Africa. Nkrumah; coups then multiparty democracy; oil and growth.

GRC.overview: Southern Balkan country; Mediterranean. Capital Athens.
GRC.knownFor: Ancient philosophy, islands, olives, and debt crisis.
GRC.quickHistory: Classical civilization; Byzantine and Ottoman. Independent 1821; republic. EU member; tourism and shipping.

GRL.overview: Danish autonomous territory; world's largest island. Capital Nuuk.
GRL.knownFor: Ice sheet, Inuit culture, and climate change.
GRL.quickHistory: Norwegian then Danish; home rule 1979. Mining and fishing; independence debate.

GTM.overview: Central American country; Pacific and Caribbean. Capital Guatemala City.
GTM.knownFor: Maya heritage, volcanoes, coffee, and migration.
GTM.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1821. Long civil war; peace 1996; inequality and violence; many migrate north.

GIN.overview: West African country on the Atlantic. Capital Conakry.
GIN.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1958. Sekou Touré; coups and unrest; rich minerals.

GNB.overview: Small West African country. Capital Bissau.
GNB.knownFor: Cashew nuts, coups, and Portuguese Creole.
GNB.quickHistory: Portuguese Guinea; independent 1974. Repeated coups; drug trafficking hub; fragile state.

GUY.overview: Only English-speaking country in South America. Capital Georgetown.
GUY.quickHistory: British Guiana; independent 1966. Sugar and bauxite; border dispute with Venezuela.

HTI.overview: Caribbean country on Hispaniola. Capital Port-au-Prince.
HTI.knownFor: First black republic, Creole, and resilience amid poverty and disasters.
HTI.quickHistory: French Saint-Domingue; slave revolt; independent 1804. Duvaliers; earthquakes and cholera; ongoing crisis.

HND.overview: Central American country; Caribbean and Pacific. Capital Tegucigalpa.
HND.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1821. Coups and inequality; hurricanes; many leave for US.

HUN.overview: Landlocked Central European country. Capital Budapest.
HUN.knownFor: Thermal baths, goulash, and EU member with illiberal turn.
HUN.quickHistory: Magyar kingdom; Habsburg then independent. Soviet bloc; 1956 uprising; EU member; Orbán's illiberal democracy.

ISL.overview: North Atlantic island nation. Capital Reykjavík.
ISL.knownFor: Geysers, glaciers, Northern Lights, and financial crash and recovery.
ISL.quickHistory: Settled by Norse; Danish rule; independent 1944. Fishing and aluminium; 2008 crash; tourism boom.

IND.overview: South Asian giant; second-most populous. Capital New Delhi.
IND.knownFor: Taj Mahal, spices, IT, Bollywood, and diversity.
IND.quickHistory: Ancient civilization; British Raj; independent 1947. Partition; democracy; economic liberalization; space and tech.

IDN.overview: Largest archipelago; Southeast Asia. Capital Jakarta.
IDN.knownFor: Bali, spices, volcanoes, and the world's largest Muslim-majority country.
IDN.quickHistory: Hindu-Buddhist kingdoms; Dutch East Indies; independent 1945. Sukarno and Suharto; democracy since 1998; huge diversity.

IRN.overview: Middle Eastern country; Persian heartland. Capital Tehran.
IRN.knownFor: Persian heritage, carpets, nuclear program, and Islamic Republic.
IRN.quickHistory: Ancient Persia; 1979 revolution; theocracy. Iran–Iraq war; regional influence; sanctions and protests.

IRQ.overview: Middle Eastern country; Tigris and Euphrates. Capital Baghdad.
IRQ.knownFor: Mesopotamia, oil, and decades of conflict.
IRQ.quickHistory: Cradle of civilization; British mandate; monarchy then republic. Saddam Hussein; 2003 invasion; sectarian conflict and ISIS.

IRL.overview: Island in the North Atlantic; EU member. Capital Dublin.
IRL.knownFor: Pub culture, literature, green landscapes, and tech HQs.
IRL.quickHistory: British rule; independence 1922 (partial); republic 1949. Celtic Tiger; EU member; Brexit border issue with UK.

ISR.knownFor: Holy sites, tech sector, and conflict with Palestinians.
ISR.quickHistory: Zionist state 1948; wars with Arab states. Occupation of Palestinian territories; peace with Egypt and Jordan; ongoing conflict.

ITA.overview: Southern European peninsula and islands. Capital Rome.
ITA.knownFor: Roman heritage, Renaissance, food, fashion, and Vatican.
ITA.quickHistory: Roman Empire; city-states; unification 1861. Fascism and WWII; republic; EU founder; debt and politics.

CIV.overview: West African country on the Gulf of Guinea. Capital Yamoussoukro.
CIV.quickHistory: French Ivory Coast; independent 1960. Houphouët-Boigny; civil war and reconciliation; French military presence.

JAM.overview: Caribbean island; third-largest of Greater Antilles. Capital Kingston.
JAM.knownFor: Reggae, Bob Marley, rum, and athletics.
JAM.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1962. Music and sport; tourism and bauxite; crime and emigration.

JPN.overview: East Asian island nation. Capital Tokyo.
JPN.knownFor: Anime, sushi, temples, technology, and cherry blossoms.
JPN.quickHistory: Emperor and shoguns; Meiji modernization; WWII defeat. Pacifist constitution; economic miracle; aging society.

JOR.overview: Middle Eastern kingdom; no oil. Capital Amman.
JOR.knownFor: Petra, desert castles, and refugee hosting.
JOR.quickHistory: British mandate; independent 1946. Hashemite monarchy; peace with Israel; hosts many refugees; limited resources.

KAZ.overview: Largest landlocked country; Central Asia. Capital Astana.
KAZ.knownFor: Steppe, oil, Soviet legacy, and Baikonur.
KAZ.quickHistory: Soviet republic; independent 1991. Nazarbayev long rule; oil and gas; multi-ethnic; capital moved to Astana.

KEN.overview: East African country on the Indian Ocean. Capital Nairobi.
KEN.knownFor: Safari, marathon runners, tea, and tech hub.
KEN.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1963. Stability and growth; ethnic tensions and elections; M-Pesa and innovation.

KOS.overview: Balkan country; independence disputed. Capital Pristina.
KOS.knownFor: Young state, Albanian majority, and EU aspirations.
KOS.quickHistory: Part of Serbia/Yugoslavia; 2008 declaration of independence; not recognized by all; EU and NATO path.

KWT.overview: Small Gulf state. Capital Kuwait City.
KWT.knownFor: Oil, Gulf War, and constitutional monarchy.
KWT.quickHistory: British protectorate; independent 1961. Iraqi invasion 1990; liberated by coalition; oil wealth and parliament.

KGZ.overview: Landlocked Central Asian country. Capital Bishkek.
KGZ.quickHistory: Soviet republic; independent 1991. Two revolutions; Russian base; remittances and instability.

LAO.overview: Landlocked Southeast Asian country. Capital Vientiane.
LAO.knownFor: Mekong, Buddhist temples, and one-party state.
LAO.quickHistory: French Indochina; independent 1953. Secret bombing during Vietnam War; communist rule; hydropower and Chinese influence.

LVA.overview: Baltic country on the Gulf of Riga. Capital Riga.
LVA.knownFor: Art Nouveau, song festivals, and EU member.
LVA.quickHistory: Soviet 1940–1991; independent again. EU and NATO; emigration and demographic concerns.

LBN.knownFor: Cedar, sectarian politics, and cultural legacy.
LBN.quickHistory: French mandate; independent 1943. Civil war; Syrian and Israeli involvement; port blast 2020; economic collapse.

LSO.overview: Landlocked kingdom surrounded by South Africa. Capital Maseru.
LSO.quickHistory: British Basutoland; independent 1966. Constitutional monarchy; dependent on South Africa; diamond mining.

LBR.overview: West African country; founded by freed slaves. Capital Monrovia.
LBR.knownFor: Liberian civil wars, rubber, and Ebola.
LBR.quickHistory: Founded 1847 by US freed slaves. Tubman; coups and civil wars; Ebola 2014; peace and recovery.

LBY.overview: North African country; mostly desert. Capital Tripoli.
LBY.knownFor: Oil, ancient sites, and post-Gaddafi chaos.
LBY.quickHistory: Italian then independent 1951. Gaddafi 1969–2011; revolution and civil conflict; two rival governments.

LTU.overview: Baltic country on the Baltic Sea. Capital Vilnius.
LTU.knownFor: Amber, medieval Old Town, and EU member.
LTU.quickHistory: Grand Duchy; Polish–Lithuanian; Soviet 1940–1991. Independent again; EU and NATO; emigration.

LUX.overview: Small Western European grand duchy. Capital Luxembourg.
LUX.knownFor: EU institutions, banking, and high GDP per capita.
LUX.quickHistory: Independent 1839. EU founding member; multilingual; wealthy and stable.

MDG.overview: Large island off East Africa. Capital Antananarivo.
MDG.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1960. Political instability; biodiversity; poverty and cyclones.

MWI.overview: Landlocked East African country. Capital Lilongwe.
MWI.knownFor: Lake Malawi, tea, and dependence on aid.
MWI.quickHistory: British Nyasaland; independent 1964. Banda long rule; democracy; one of poorest; tobacco and tea.

MYS.overview: Southeast Asian country; peninsula and Borneo. Capital Kuala Lumpur.
MYS.knownFor: Petronas Towers, rainforest, and multicultural society.
MYS.quickHistory: British Malaya; independent 1957; Malaysia 1963. Authoritarian then reform; palm oil and electronics.

MLI.overview: Landlocked West African country; Sahel. Capital Bamako.
MLI.quickHistory: Mali Empire; French Sudan; independent 1960. Coups; north occupied by jihadists; French and UN intervention.

MRT.overview: Northwest African country; Sahara and Atlantic. Capital Nouakchott.
MRT.knownFor: Desert, iron ore, and slavery legacy.
MRT.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1960. Arab–Black African tension; fishing and mining; ongoing slavery concerns.

MEX.overview: North American country; Pacific and Gulf. Capital Mexico City.
MEX.knownFor: Ancient civilizations, tacos, tequila, and diaspora.
MEX.quickHistory: Aztec and Maya; Spanish colony; independence 1821. Revolution 1910; PRI dominance; NAFTA; drug violence and migration.

MDA.overview: Landlocked Eastern European country. Capital Chișinău.
MDA.knownFor: Wine, Transnistria conflict, and EU aspiration.
MDA.quickHistory: Soviet Moldova; independent 1991. Transnistria breakaway; Russian troops; EU candidate; emigration.

MNG.overview: Landlocked between Russia and China; steppe. Capital Ulaanbaatar.
MNG.quickHistory: Mongol Empire; Qing then Soviet influence. Independent 1921; democracy 1990; coal and copper; harsh winters.

MNE.overview: Small Balkan country on the Adriatic. Capital Podgorica.
MNE.knownFor: Bay of Kotor, mountains, and NATO member.
MNE.quickHistory: Part of Yugoslavia then Serbia; independent 2006. EU and NATO candidate; tourism.

MAR.overview: North African country; Atlantic and Mediterranean. Capital Rabat.
MAR.knownFor: Marrakesh, souks, Sahara, and French influence.
MAR.quickHistory: Berber and Arab; French and Spanish protectorates; independent 1956. Monarchy; stability; tourism and migration.

MOZ.overview: Southeast African country; long coast. Capital Maputo.
MOZ.knownFor: Beaches, civil war legacy, and gas discoveries.
MOZ.quickHistory: Portuguese colony; independent 1975. Long civil war; RENAMO; recent gas and debt crisis.

MMR.overview: Southeast Asian country; formerly Burma. Capital Naypyidaw.
MMR.knownFor: Pagan, Aung San Suu Kyi, and military coup.
MMR.quickHistory: British Burma; independent 1948. Military rule; brief opening; 2021 coup; Rohingya crisis.

NAM.overview: Southwest African country; sparse population. Capital Windhoek.
NAM.knownFor: Etosha, desert, and German colonial legacy.
NAM.quickHistory: German then South African; independent 1990. Stable democracy; mining and tourism.

NPL.overview: Himalayan country between India and China. Capital Kathmandu.
NPL.knownFor: Everest, Hinduism and Buddhism, and monarchy to republic.
NPL.quickHistory: Kingdom; never colonized. Maoist insurgency; republic 2008; earthquake 2015; remittances.

NLD.overview: Northwest European country; below sea level. Capital Amsterdam.
NLD.quickHistory: Dutch Republic; kingdom. Neutral in WWII; EU founder; liberal society; Rotterdam port.

NCL.knownFor: Nickel, Kanak culture, and independence referendums.
NCL.quickHistory: French since 1853; referendums on independence (narrowly stayed French); nickel mining.

NZL.overview: South Pacific country; two main islands. Capital Wellington.
NZL.knownFor: Rugby, Lord of the Rings, sheep, and Māori culture.
NZL.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1947. Nuclear-free; progressive; agriculture and tourism.

NIC.overview: Central American country; largest in region. Capital Managua.
NIC.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1821. Somoza; Sandinista revolution; Contra war; Ortega's return and authoritarian turn.

NER.overview: Landlocked West African country; Sahel. Capital Niamey.
NER.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1960. Coups; French and US bases; one of world's poorest.

NGA.overview: Africa's most populous country. Capital Abuja.
NGA.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1960. Civil war; military and civilian rule; Boko Haram; huge population and economy.

PRK.overview: East Asian one-party state. Capital Pyongyang.
PRK.knownFor: Nuclear program, isolation, and dynastic rule.
PRK.quickHistory: Divided 1945; Korean War; Kim dynasty. Juche; nuclear tests; one of most closed societies.

MKD.overview: Balkan country; name disputed with Greece. Capital Skopje.
MKD.knownFor: Alexander heritage debate, Lake Ohrid, and NATO member.
MKD.quickHistory: Yugoslav republic; independent 1991. Name dispute (North Macedonia 2019); EU candidate.

CYN.overview: De facto state in northern Cyprus; only Turkey recognizes. Capital North Nicosia.
CYN.knownFor: Beach tourism and Turkish Cypriot community.
CYN.quickHistory: Declared 1983 after Turkish invasion of Cyprus; not internationally recognized.

NOR.overview: Nordic country; long coast and fjords. Capital Oslo.
NOR.knownFor: Fjords, oil, peace prize, and outdoor life.
NOR.quickHistory: Viking age; union with Denmark then Sweden; independent 1905. Oil wealth; high equality; outside EU.

OMN.overview: Gulf state on Arabian Peninsula. Capital Muscat.
OMN.quickHistory: Portuguese then Omani empire; British influence; Sultan Qaboos 1970–2020; balanced foreign policy.

PAK.overview: South Asian country; Indus and mountains. Capital Islamabad.
PAK.knownFor: K2, Mughal heritage, and nuclear power.
PAK.quickHistory: Part of British India; independent 1947. Military coups; Kashmir conflict; Taliban and terrorism; large population.

PSX.overview: Palestinian territories; Gaza and West Bank. Capital (claimed) Jerusalem.
PSX.knownFor: Holy sites, occupation, and statehood struggle.
PSX.quickHistory: British mandate; 1948 partition; Israeli occupation 1967. Fatah and Hamas; no full statehood.

PAN.overview: Central American isthmus; canal. Capital Panama City.
PAN.quickHistory: Spanish then Colombian; independent 1903 with US support. Canal handed to Panama 1999; banking and logistics.

PNG.overview: Pacific country; half of New Guinea island. Capital Port Moresby.
PNG.quickHistory: Australian territory; independent 1975. Many languages; mining and gas; law and order challenges.

PRY.overview: Landlocked South American country. Capital Asunción.
PRY.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1811. Stroessner dictatorship; democracy; soy and hydroelectric.

PER.overview: Pacific and Amazon country; Andes. Capital Lima.
PER.knownFor: Machu Picchu, Inca heritage, and gastronomy.
PER.quickHistory: Inca Empire; Spanish conquest; independence 1821. Shining Path; Fujimori; growth and political instability.

PHL.overview: Southeast Asian archipelago; 7,000+ islands. Capital Manila.
PHL.quickHistory: Spanish then US; independent 1946. Marcos and People Power; OFWs; Duterte; typhoons.

POL.overview: Central European country; Baltic coast. Capital Warsaw.
POL.quickHistory: Partitions; WWII devastation; communist; Solidarity 1980s. Democratic 1989; EU and NATO; rule-of-law tensions.

PRT.overview: Southwest European country; Atlantic. Capital Lisbon.
PRT.knownFor: Fado, explorers, port wine, and affordable living.
PRT.quickHistory: Kingdom; colonial empire. Carnation Revolution 1974; EU member; tourism and emigration.

PRI.overview: Caribbean US territory. Capital San Juan.
PRI.quickHistory: Spanish then US 1898. Commonwealth; debt crisis; hurricanes; statehood vs independence debate.

QAT.knownFor: Gas wealth, Al Jazeera, and World Cup 2022.
QAT.quickHistory: British; independent 1971. Al Thani rule; huge gas reserves; regional mediator; labor and rights criticism.

SRB.overview: Balkan country; no coastline. Capital Belgrade.
SRB.knownFor: Orthodox heritage, Kosovo dispute, and EU path.
SRB.quickHistory: Yugoslav core; Milošević; NATO bombing 1999. Kosovo independence disputed; EU candidate.

COG.overview: Central African country on the equator. Capital Brazzaville.
COG.knownFor: Oil, Congo River, and French influence.
COG.quickHistory: French Congo; independent 1960. Sassou-Nguesso long rule; oil-dependent.

ROU.overview: Southeast European country; Black Sea. Capital Bucharest.
ROU.quickHistory: Roman then Ottoman influence; kingdom; communist; revolution 1989. EU member; emigration and corruption.

RUS.overview: Largest country by area; spans Europe and Asia. Capital Moscow.
RUS.knownFor: Vodka, literature, space program, and authoritarian turn.
RUS.quickHistory: Tsarist empire; USSR 1922–1991. Putin era; annexation of Crimea; war on Ukraine; sanctions.

RWA.overview: Landlocked East African country. Capital Kigali.
RWA.knownFor: Gorillas, genocide memory, and development model.
RWA.quickHistory: Belgian Rwanda; independent 1962. Genocide 1994; Kagame's recovery and authoritarian development.

SAU.overview: Arabian Peninsula; birthplace of Islam. Capital Riyadh.
SAU.knownFor: Oil, Mecca and Medina, and Vision 2030.
SAU.quickHistory: Kingdom 1932; oil from 1938. US alliance; Wahhabism; crown prince's reforms and repression.

SEN.overview: West African country on the Atlantic. Capital Dakar.
SEN.knownFor: Teranga, peanut basin, and democratic stability.
SEN.quickHistory: French colony; independent 1960. Senghor; stable democracy; French military base; wrestling and arts.

SLE.overview: West African country on the Atlantic. Capital Freetown.
SLE.quickHistory: British colony for freed slaves; independent 1961. Brutal civil war; diamonds; Ebola 2014; recovery.

SVK.overview: Landlocked Central European country. Capital Bratislava.
SVK.knownFor: Tatra Mountains, EU member, and eurozone.
SVK.quickHistory: Czechoslovakia; split 1993. EU and NATO; car industry; political turbulence.

SVN.overview: Small Alpine and Adriatic country. Capital Ljubljana.
SVN.knownFor: Alps, Lake Bled, and EU member.
SVN.quickHistory: Yugoslav republic; independent 1991 (brief war). EU and NATO; prosperous; Schengen.

SLB.overview: Pacific island nation; Melanesia. Capital Honiara.
SLB.knownFor: Coral reefs, WWII history, and logging.
SLB.quickHistory: British protectorate; independent 1978. Ethnic tension; RAMSI; logging and fisheries.

SOM.overview: Horn of Africa; long coastline. Capital Mogadishu.
SOM.knownFor: Piracy, civil war, and fragile government.
SOM.quickHistory: Italian and British; independent 1960. Collapse 1991; Al-Shabaab; African Union mission; no full stability.

SOL.overview: De facto state in Somalia; limited recognition. Capital Hargeisa.
SOL.quickHistory: Declared independent 1991; not recognized; more stable than Somalia.

ZAF.overview: Southern tip of Africa. Capital Pretoria; Cape Town legislative.
ZAF.knownFor: Apartheid history, Mandela, wildlife, and diversity.
ZAF.quickHistory: British and Boer; apartheid 1948–1994. Democratic 1994; inequality and crime; BRICS; diverse economy.

KOR.overview: East Asian peninsula; divided. Capital Seoul.
KOR.knownFor: K-pop, Samsung, demilitarized zone, and rapid development.
KOR.quickHistory: Japanese colony; divided 1945; Korean War. Authoritarian then democracy; tech and culture export.

SDS.overview: Landlocked East African country; youngest state. Capital Juba.
SDS.quickHistory: Part of Sudan; independent 2011. Civil war 2013–2020; fragile peace; oil and humanitarian crisis.

ESP.overview: Southwest European country; Iberian Peninsula. Capital Madrid.
ESP.knownFor: Flamenco, paella, siesta, and regional diversity.
ESP.quickHistory: Reconquista; empire; civil war 1936–1939. Franco; democracy 1975; EU; Catalonia and Basque.

LKA.overview: Island off South India. Capital Colombo.
LKA.knownFor: Tea, Buddhism, and civil war legacy.
LKA.quickHistory: British Ceylon; independent 1948. Tamil conflict ended 2009; Buddhist majority; economic crisis 2022.

SDN.overview: Northeast African country; Nile. Capital Khartoum.
SDN.knownFor: Pyramids of Meroë, oil, and conflict.
SDN.quickHistory: British–Egyptian condominium; independent 1956. Coups; Darfur; South Sudan secession 2011; recent war.

SUR.overview: Small country on north South American coast. Capital Paramaribo.
SUR.quickHistory: Dutch Guiana; independent 1975. Coups then democracy; ethnic diversity; gold and bauxite.

SWE.overview: Nordic country; long coast. Capital Stockholm.
SWE.knownFor: IKEA, ABBA, welfare state, and neutrality.
SWE.quickHistory: Viking age; empire then neutrality. WWII neutral; high equality; EU member; NATO application.

CHE.quickHistory: Confederation; never in EU. Neutral in wars; direct democracy; high quality of life; banking and pharma.

SYR.overview: Eastern Mediterranean country; in civil war. Capital Damascus.
SYR.knownFor: Ancient cities, war, and refugee crisis.
SYR.quickHistory: French mandate; independent 1946. Assad family; civil war since 2011; millions displaced; Russian and Iranian backing.

TWN.overview: Island off China; de facto independent. Capital Taipei.
TWN.knownFor: Tech (TSMC), night markets, and sovereignty dispute.
TWN.quickHistory: Chinese then Japanese; KMT rule from 1949. Democracy; China claims; semiconductor hub.

TJK.overview: Landlocked Central Asian country. Capital Dushanbe.
TJK.quickHistory: Soviet republic; independent 1991. Civil war; Rahmon long rule; dependent on Russia; Pamir Highway.

THA.quickHistory: Never colonized. Constitutional monarchy; coups; tourism and manufacturing; political turmoil.

BHS.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1973. Tourism and finance; hurricane damage; close to US.

TGO.overview: Narrow West African country. Capital Lomé.
TGO.knownFor: Phosphates, voodoo, and long Eyadéma rule.
TGO.quickHistory: French Togoland; independent 1960. Eyadéma dynasty; political unrest; cotton and phosphates.

TTO.overview: Twin-island Caribbean country. Capital Port of Spain.
TTO.knownFor: Carnival, oil and gas, and steelpan.
TTO.quickHistory: British colony; independent 1962. Oil and gas; multicultural; Carnival; high income.

TUN.overview: North African country; Mediterranean. Capital Tunis.
TUN.knownFor: Arab Spring birth, Roman ruins, and beaches.
TUN.quickHistory: French protectorate; independent 1956. Ben Ali; revolution 2011; democratic transition; economic struggles.

TUR.overview: Transcontinental country; Europe and Asia. Capital Ankara.
TUR.quickHistory: Ottoman Empire; republic 1923 (Atatürk). Coups; EU candidate; Erdogan's authoritarian turn; Syria and refugees.

TKM.overview: Central Asian country; Caspian coast. Capital Ashgabat.
TKM.quickHistory: Soviet republic; independent 1991. Niyazov personality cult; gas wealth; neutral; closed society.

UGA.overview: Landlocked East African country. Capital Kampala.
UGA.knownFor: Lake Victoria, gorillas, and Museveni long rule.
UGA.quickHistory: British Uganda; independent 1962. Amin; Museveni since 1986; growth and authoritarianism.

UKR.overview: Eastern European country; second-largest in Europe. Capital Kyiv.
UKR.knownFor: Chernobyl, wheat, and war with Russia.
UKR.quickHistory: Kievan Rus; Russian and Polish rule. Independent 1991; Orange Revolution; Maidan 2014; full-scale invasion 2022.

ARE.overview: Gulf federation of seven emirates. Capital Abu Dhabi.
ARE.quickHistory: British; federation 1971. Dubai and Abu Dhabi; oil and tourism; foreign labor; progressive in region.

GBR.overview: Island nation; England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland. Capital London.
GBR.quickHistory: British Empire; industrial revolution. WWII; decolonization; EU then Brexit; devolution.

TZA.overview: East African country; Kilimanjaro and Zanzibar. Capital Dodoma.
TZA.quickHistory: Tanganyika and Zanzibar united 1964. Nyerere; stability; tourism and gold; HIV and development.

USA.overview: Large North American country; Atlantic to Pacific. Capital Washington, D.C.
USA.quickHistory: British colonies; independence 1776. Civil war; world wars; superpower; polarization and inequality.

URY.overview: Small South American country on the Atlantic. Capital Montevideo.
URY.quickHistory: Spanish then Brazilian; independent 1828. Military rule then restoration; progressive; football and beef.

UZB.overview: Landlocked Central Asia; Silk Road. Capital Tashkent.
UZB.quickHistory: Soviet republic; independent 1991. Karimov long rule; gradual opening; heritage tourism.

VUT.overview: Pacific island nation; Melanesia. Capital Port Vila.
VUT.quickHistory: British–French condominium; independent 1980. Cyclones; tourism and agriculture.

VEN.overview: North South American country; Caribbean coast. Capital Caracas.
VEN.quickHistory: Spanish colony; independence 1811. Chavez and Maduro; economic collapse; migration; oil reserves.

VNM.overview: Southeast Asian country; long coast. Capital Hanoi.
VNM.knownFor: Pho, war history, and manufacturing boom.
VNM.quickHistory: French Indochina; Vietnam War; unified 1976. Doi Moi reform; manufacturing; tourism and growth.

SAH.overview: Disputed territory in northwest Africa. Capital (claimed) El-Aaiún.
SAH.quickHistory: Spanish Sahara; Morocco claims and controls most; Polisario and refugee camps in Algeria.

YEM.knownFor: Ancient Arabia, war, and humanitarian crisis.
YEM.quickHistory: North and South Yemen united 1990. Houthi takeover; Saudi-led war; famine and cholera; fragile state.

ZMB.overview: Landlocked southern African country. Capital Lusaka.
ZMB.quickHistory: British Northern Rhodesia; independent 1964. Kaunda; copper; stable democracy; Chinese investment.

ZWE.overview: Landlocked southern African country. Capital Harare.
ZWE.knownFor: Victoria Falls, hyperinflation, and Mugabe legacy.
ZWE.quickHistory: British Rhodesia; independent 1980. Mugabe long rule; land reform; economic collapse; Mnangagwa.

SWZ.overview: Small landlocked kingdom in southern Africa. Capital Mbabane.
SWZ.knownFor: King Mswati III, sugar, and HIV.
SWZ.quickHistory: British Swaziland; independent 1968. Absolute monarchy; renamed eSwatini 2018; high HIV prevalence.
